intro: Asterocephalus acutiflorus, commonly known as the sharpflower starhead, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped inflorescences that are typically pale yellow to white in color. The plant has small, lanceolate leaves that are arranged in a dense rosette pattern, allowing it to efficiently capture and retain moisture. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Asterocephalus acutiflorus is considered a vulnerable species.
